original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Tikatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (5)🔽23.21. Vipākattika, Kusalattika🔽Navipākaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Navipākaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā vipākadhammadhammo akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  vipāka attika kusala attika  na vipākam na kusalam dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na vipākam na akusalam dhammam paccayā vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The reverse order of the dependent origination, The Paṭṭhāna text with the Tika commentary🔽Resultant, wholesome

original: Navipākaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na vipākam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a resultant and not wholesome as condition, a resultant and wholesome consciousness element arises, by way of root condition. (In brief.)
